instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00875: What is 820-00875? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AP_RESET_L: What is AP_RESET_L? AP_RESET_L resets the wifi hardware when it is low, which will keep it from working. AP_RESET_L needs to be high for reset to not be asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no bluetooth
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board no liquid spill with wifi work well but bluetooth, I can't activate.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_WLS</SIGNAL> = 3,3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BT_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> = 3,4V
<SIGNAL>AP_RESET_L</SIGNAL>= 3,28V
i reball <CHIP>U3700</CHIP> but nothing change, can I change it or other kind to check?
thanks
Best regards

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no bluetooth
threads.message: What shows macOS in System Information about bluetooth controller?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no bluetooth
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00875</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no bluetooth
threads.message:
Looks like detected, but disabled.
Try to enable it through System Preferences.

threads.message:
